text: Indian equity benchmarks climbed, led by oil stocks after Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said on Wednesday that the government will not step in to check rising petrol and diesel prices at a media conference.The S&P BSE Sensex index rose as much as 0.43 percent to 32,323.57, while the NSE Nifty 50 Index 0.47 percent to Rs 10,126.50.As many as 17 out of 19 sector gauges compiled by BSE Ltd were trading higher, led by the S&P BSE Oil & Gas Index's 1.1 percent advance. The market breadth firmly tilted in favour of buyers. About 1,144 stocks advanced and 387 stocks declined on the NSE.
title: Stocks Radar: BHEL, Jubilant Foodworks, Reliance Communications, Thermax
